annotation.TEXT: Okay, now this is one of the older hacks out there, so it can be excused for using the original SMW overworld. Alright, I guess we'll start with "start". (Makes sense.)
Gotta love the land formations around here.
There we go! Now, just walk slowly to the left to walk down the stairs. Be careful: Move too fast and you'll end up on top of the pipe again.
More coins, just in case you didn't get enough from the bonus room.
Right off the bat, you know this game's good. The cutoff is nicely distributed, and apparently we're off to save some princes in addition to the usual princess!
You can grab another power up here if you need to. (And you can make it jump up by hitting a nearby turn block after it emerges. What fun!)
Whoa! Look at all those berries! Yoshi must've done something cool to grow all those!
Demo count: 1
Alright, found a pipe that goes somewhere! Oh, boy! Look at all those coins! But, be careful of the bouncing Rex heads!
G
Make sure not to be over any part of the pit when the P-switch ends and you should be fine.
In fact, it's so good, I've played through it twice! So, since nothing special happens on the title screen, let's start a new game in slot 3 here...
To be continued...
Maybe I can block clone up an extra power up to make up for that embarrassing hit...

Well, I know I've gotta push one of them, but which one? That's the stumper! You know what? I'll let you guys decide! Which one of these switches should I stomp? Vote now, and we'll find out next time!
Hahah! Can I do it again?
Sweet, another flower! Now, let's try not to lose this one within five seconds, if at all possible!
There's a few mushrooms here too, just in case you need them.
Holy cow! Look at all them switches! Here, let me scroll the screen so you can see them better.
And, just like that, I've found every Yoshi coin in this level! Apparently there were six to find.
Okay, let's do this for real this time!
Secret: You can walk right through this small piece of pipe from the right.
Also, if you jump just right, you can walk down some invisible stairs embedded in the largest pipe!
Just be careful, because that P-switch doesn't last forever, and you wouldn't want to fall into a pit when it expires at the wrong time!
Well, as is tradition, let's go to the level on the left first. "field of koopers 1", eh?
Nuts. Well, I got one bonus power up out of it. Now, this flower isn't as trapped as it looks. If you rub the corner of the block the right way, you can still collect it!
D'oh! What the heck, kooper?! Why'd you have to be such a jerk?
Oh, and I will be sure to have fun, and don't worry about your English. I've seen worse, believe me!
Watch out for the mutant fish plant that likes to stick out of the solid green pipe here. If you have fireballs or a kooper shell, you can destroy it!
F
Oh, yeah! This levl deseign is rockin' so far!
Whoops! That was a demo. Yeah, there's an invisible hole at the bottom of the stairs that you have to watch out for as well...
Okay, now unlike the original game, coins won't appear absolutely everywhere when you stomp the P-switch. You have to move to the right a bit to find them.
Oh, yeah, when you play this hack, make sure you read all of the message boxes! They can be very insightful!
Alright, now in this next room, there are some 1-up mushrooms to collect, but also beware of a couple of parakoopers that have taken up residence here.
Gotta check the two-toned pipes with bushes on them, too!
C
Oh, yeah! It's gotta be the best! It doesn't even need proper spelling or grammar to be good!
Let's try that one again. At least I have my reserve item...
H
Don't jump too high here or that Banzai Bill might intercept you. Instead, stay down here and pick on this kooper.
D
A
Gotta check every pipe, even the half-pipes!
E
B
Alright, it's the goal! How many stars will I get this time?
Oh, wait. I guess this isn't his home. I guess I got mixed up with some other guy named Yoshi...
Gee, I wonder how you're supposed to reach those koopers... Well, maybe I could slurp them up if I had Yoshi...
Okay, there's our first kooper, falling from a high up ledge.
30 stars! That's almost one-third the way to being able to play a bonus game!
YAAAHHH!!! Just like that. That was a demo to show you what might happen if you're not paying attention as a P-switch runs out.
Well, I can at least get another mushroom in reserve.
Oh, man, really?! I managed to get hit by the very first kooper?
Awesome, more koopers! Ooh, and a Banzai Bill and another mushroom! Even more awesome!
Okay, upon clearing field of koopers 1, a path leading up the mountain is revealed, just like in the original game. Is there a switch palace up there?
Yep, and just like it says, "here is the switch". That is such a fitting level name.
...Chaos CompleXX! This is one of the first hacks I ever played, and it's one of my favorites.
Still, there's a ton of coins to collect once you do find them!
Awesome, a mushroom!
However, these guys should be no match for a game master like you, right?
Demo count: 2
That Banzai Bill was kind of low, so try not to overshoot with your jump if you want to stomp him!
You can open up a hole here by spin jumping while powered up, but don't fall into it. It's actually a trap that'll kill you!
Now, if you're a little greedy and a little daring, you can get a few more coins by jumping across the pit using the brown blocks after the P-switch ends.
Those coins down there are impossible to get right now. I'll have to come back later after I get the capability to reach them.
Hello, this is SomeGuy712x! I've decided I don't quite want to leave YouTube yet, so I'm going to be playing through...
Okay, I'm not going to waste any more time coin collecting here. Let's move on.
